arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Alfie May double downs Stockport
arts.sum: The same combination provided Blues’ second goal 10 minutes before half-time. Stansfield played an important part in Blues’ game-clinching second goal with a neat pass through to Anderson.

arts.ttl: Alfie May scores twice as Birmingham keep pressure on top two
arts.sum: The Blues are one point off second-placed Wrexham with two games in hand.

arts.ttl: Tom Wagner sends Birmingham City message as Knighthead jet in for Stockport
arts.sum: Birmingham City chairman Tom Wagner will attend Wednesday’s blockbuster League One fixture against Stockport County at St Andrew’s @ Knighthead Park. Wagner and his cohorts have frequented St Andrew’s regularly this season to watch their high-flying team and they are jetting in to witness the opening of the new fan park.

arts.ttl: ‘I just want to play’ – Birmingham City summer signing has say on move so far

arts.ttl: Wednesday's League One predictions including Birmingham City vs. Stockport County
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Birmingham City vs. Stockport County.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City could see history-making decision create £37m shortfall
arts.sum: Birmingham City could witness the removal of the long-standing 3pm blackout once the existing broadcast deals for Premier League and EFL clubs expire. No fewer than 20 of Blues' matches this season will be screened on TV as part of Sky's new deal with the EFL.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City set to be without five players for Stockport clash
arts.sum: Wingers Hansson and Wright have been sidelined for around six weeks now, while Sampsted has missed the last three games with an ankle injury sustained on international duty. Birmingham City are again expected to be without injured trio Emil Hansson, Scott Wright and Alfons Sampsted against Stockport County on Wednesday night.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies sets Marc Leonard challenge as Paik and Iwata nail down Birmingham City spots
arts.sum: Chris Davies expects midfielder Marc Leonard to continue progressing 'through the levels' as he bids to apply even more pressure to current first choice Birmingham City midfield pairing Paik Seung-ho and Tomoki Iwata. "Their most creative force was Apter, who is a dangerous, left-footed right winger, but Ethan did a great job on him.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City predicted XI vs Stockport as Chris Davies considers three big calls - Joseph Chapman - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: Stansfield, Cochrane, Klarer Willumsson, Iwata, Paik Seung-ho and Ryan Allsop are all in line to return for the bread and butter of Blues' season. Jay Stansfield, Alex Cochrane and Willum Willumsson stayed in Birmingham, while Tomoki Iwata, Christoph Klarer and Ben Davies were involved but weren't needed .
